top_categories.workout_context: Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet’s appalachian mountains, forest gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet’s appalachian gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet. Make this intensity feel like home.
Racing Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet’s 6,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet’s appalachian gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Every session at Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet’s 6,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet’s 75 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on appalachian gravel to build confidence. Expect: appalachian mountains, forest gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 75 miles of appalachian gravel in Hot Springs, North Carolina.
